Row.Text: I'm not interested in this.
Nothing happens.
Crowded Markets, Foreign Tongues

Crowds gather in your city's marketplace, voices from many different lands ringing out as deals are struck and bargains made. Some are angry about this, and believe that foreigners will destroy our trade. Others, however, encourage the foreign business, hoping to learn from their culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Let the foreigners continue to trade.
Market in City: +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, -1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Implement heavy taxes on imported goods.
Market in City: +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Icons of Our Past

Monuments represent the most important symbols of your culture. Your people seek to celebrate this by dedicating the City's Monument to either their ancestors, or to their gods.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Dedicate the Monument to our ancestors.
Monument in City: +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
The gods are what is important now.
Monument in City: +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Neither will suffice. The Monument should generate revenue.
Monument in City: +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Rich Vein

A rich vein of blue marble was discovered at the quarry near the city. Your miners and masons have come to you to ask you what you would like to do it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from the options below...
Boast of this, and merchants will come to buy it from us.
+50 [ICON_GOLD], scaling with Era, and 10 turns of 'We Love the King Day' in the City.
Donate it to the Temple.
+50 [ICON_PEACE] Faith, scaling with Era.
Carve relics and idols from it.
+20 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +20 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, scaling with Era.
Give it to our finest artists.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the City for 40 turns.
Old Men and the Sea.
A band of local fishermen have appealed to the City for funding for a seasonal fishing expedition.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from the following options...
Let's focus on something simple.
Lose 50 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, scaling with Era. 50% Chance to gain +75 [ICON_FOOD] Food in the City.
A large investment will pay dividends.
Lose 150 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, scaling with Era. 50% Chance that Fishing Boats near the City will gain +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food for 40 turns.
I'd rather invest in real estate.
Lose 300 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. A Lighthouse is constructed in the City.
Drought
Drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next 50 turns, Farms produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Severe Drought
Severe drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next 50 turns, Farms produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and a nearby Farm is destroyed.
Critical Drought
Critical drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next 50 turns, Farms produce -2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and 2 nearby Farms are destroyed.
